author: NewsRamp.com
title: SmartLab International Sponsors Major Blockchain Event in Malaysia - citybuzz
text: SmartLab International, a company specializing in artificial intelligence (AI) applications for market-spread trading, has made a significant move in the blockchain space by sponsoring the Web3Dev Global Track event in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The company joined forces with other notable sponsors, including the Solana Foundation and InvestHK, a department of the Hong Kong Government responsible for Foreign Direct Investment. The Web3Dev Global Track event served as a crucial platform for developers and blockchain enthusiasts from around the world to connect, network, and explore the latest trends in Web3 technology. With over 60 speakers in attendance, the event covered a wide range of topics, including AI+DePin, DeFi, GameFi, SocialFi, Real World Assets (RWA), PropTech, Alt-coins, Memecoins, and Layer 1 & Layer 2 solutions. Participants had the opportunity to engage in hands-on coding sessions and workshops, providing practical experience and insights into the rapidly evolving blockchain landscape. The event facilitated meaningful interactions and knowledge sharing, empowering attendees to explore new ideas and solutions that could potentially drive the industry forward. Alex Wu, CEO of SmartLab International, emphasized the importance of the company’s sponsorship, stating, ‘As a relatively new player in the blockchain and crypto space, SmartLab International, through sponsorship of this event, hopes to build greater brand-name awareness while also reinforcing our commitment to fostering innovation and collaboration within the blockchain ecosystem.’ Wu further expressed the company’s aspirations, saying, ‘SmartLab International hopes that through sponsorship of the Web3Dev Global Track Event, we can contribute to the growth of Web3 technology, and this event showcased the immense potential of our efforts.’ The success of the Web3Dev Global Track event underscores the growing significance of Web3 technologies and the need for continued dialogue among industry leaders. As blockchain technology continues to evolve and find new applications across various sectors, events like these play a crucial role in shaping the future of the industry. SmartLab International’s participation in this event marks a strategic move for the company, as it seeks to establish itself as a key player in the blockchain and cryptocurrency space. By aligning itself with other prominent organizations and supporting developer-focused initiatives, SmartLab International demonstrates its commitment to driving innovation and fostering collaboration within the ecosystem. The sponsorship of the Web3Dev Global Track event also highlights the increasing interest of AI-focused companies in blockchain technology. As the intersection between AI and blockchain continues to grow, events like these provide valuable opportunities for cross-pollination of ideas and the development of new, innovative solutions. For the broader blockchain and cryptocurrency industry, the success of events like the Web3Dev Global Track signals a maturing ecosystem that is attracting attention from diverse sectors. The involvement of government entities, such as InvestHK, alongside private companies and foundations, demonstrates the growing recognition of blockchain’s potential impact on various industries and economies. As the Web3 landscape continues to evolve, events that bring together developers, industry experts, and enthusiasts will play an increasingly important role in shaping the future of the technology. SmartLab International’s sponsorship of the Web3Dev Global Track event not only positions the company as a forward-thinking player in the space but also contributes to the overall growth and development of the blockchain ecosystem. For more information about SmartLab International and its initiatives, interested parties can visit the company’s [website](https://smartlab.international/index.html). This news story relied on a press release distributed by [BlockchainWire](https://blockchainwire.io). Blockchain Registration, Verification & Enhancement provided by [NewsRamp™.](https://newsramp.com) The source URL for this press release is [SmartLab International Sponsors Major Blockchain Event in Malaysia.](https://newsramp.com/curated-news/smartlab-international-sponsors-web3dev-global-track-event/133ff744ffed1cbe5d78e2b977c1470e)

author: Gabrielle M. Etzel
title: Planned Parenthood sting video suppressed by Harris released after nine years
text: Video footage captured in 2015 by an [anti-abortion](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/tag/abortion/) activist that was suppressed by then-California Attorney General [Kamala Harris ](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/tag/kamala-harris/)was released Thursday, revealing discussions among [Planned Parenthood](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/tag/planned-parenthood/) executives about the handling of body parts of fetuses aborted in the late second trimester, which activists have alleged amount to an admission of wrongdoing. The video was [recorded](https://nypost.com/2024/08/08/us-news/undercover-video-allegedly-shows-planned-parenthood-scandal/) by David Daleiden of the Center for Medical Progress, who, with a colleague in 2015, went undercover to the National Abortion Federation’s commercial trade show. Since July 2015, the videos have been suppressed following a court injunction that was lifted in May following their incorporation into the federal congressional record during a hearing on abortion hosted by Rep. [Marjorie Taylor Greene](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/tag/marjorie-taylor-greene/) (R-GA). As Daleiden faces criminal charges for recording the videos surreptitiously, Harris’s role as attorney general of California at the onset of the case is likely to draw more attention as she campaigns for the presidency. Content of the suppressed videos In two different videos published on Thursday, Daleiden talks with the chief medical officer of Planned Parenthood Gulf Coast, Dr. Ann Schutt-Ainé, and the branch’s vice president of abortion access, Tram Nguyen. PPGC, based in Houston, closed following the federal Dobbs v. Jackson Women’s Health Organization decision in June 2022. One of the [videos](https://youtu.be/oIzXl0r1N20?si=KUNGDBluM1jDZR3V) shows both Schutt-Ainé and Nguyen describing how they take measures to avoid prosecution under the federal partial-birth abortion ban by dismembering the fetus while it is partially outside the womb to preserve the internal organs of the fetus for harvesting. “If I’m doing a procedure, and I’m seeing that I’m in fear that it’s about to come to the umbilicus [navel], I might ask for a second set of forceps to hold the body at the cervix and pull off a leg, or two, so it’s not PBA,” Schutt-Ainé said in the video. In a different [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s1WcII0F5-A), Nguyen describes for Daleiden one scenario in which a minor patient’s discomfort required the physician “to hurry up” and compared it to “other days [when] it’s more intact, where it’s, like, maybe only, like, an arm that’s disarticulated.” Later in the video, Nguyen describes how awkward discussing fetal tissue can be, remarking, “I’m like, ‘Yeah, I have like a leg for you.’ I’m like, oh s***, if other people were to hear me, they’d be like, you are f***ing evil.” During the entire controversy, the Planned Parenthood Federation of America has maintained that it does not profit commercially from aborted fetal tissue from second- or third-trimester abortions but rather donates fetal tissue for scientific research. During the height of the controversy in 2015, the [National Abortion Federation](https://prochoice.org/naf-supports-fetal-tissue-donation-for-humanitarian-and-medical-research/) issued a statement saying that it supports the use of aborted fetal tissue for scientific research that “has the potential to help millions of Americans suffering from diabetes, Parkinson’s, Alzheimer’s, muscular dystrophy, leukemia, and other serious medical conditions.” “Medical progress should not be impeded by those whose agenda is to demonize abortion providers and make abortion care inaccessible for women,” the 2015 NAF statement reads. “We cannot allow underhanded, misleading tactics by anti-abortion extremists to stigmatize life-saving medical research.” Harris’s role in the Daleiden investigation Harris was attorney general of California at the time and was directly involved in the prosecution of Daleiden. This includes the controversial decision to raid Daleiden’s home, during which [officers](https://www.politico.com/story/2016/04/california-investigators-search-daleidens-home-221604) took his personal laptop and multiple hard drives. Letters obtained from court documents from Harris’s time as attorney general reveal that she had met with Planned Parenthood executives prior to the raid on Daleiden’s home that resulted in the seizure of the videos. At the time, Harris was running for California’s open Senate seat and had been endorsed by Planned Parenthood. Harris [drew fire](https://www.politico.com/story/2016/04/anti-abortion-groups-kamala-harris-resign-david-daleiden-221681) following the raid from anti-abortion groups, who said that it was a significant conflict of interest. Nearly 10 years later, anti-abortion advocates are reviving interest in the case, arguing that Harris abused the California Department of Justice for political motives while in office. Most recent updates in the case The legal battle regarding these videos has continued for the past nine years with no end in sight. In March, Daleiden [used](https://www.courthousenews.com/judge-considers-free-speech-rights-for-anti-abortion-activist-who-reposted-video-footage/) portions of the enjoined video during a congressional hearing hosted by Greene titled “Investigating Baby Organ Harvesting Black Market.” Following the hearing, Daleiden posted unredacted videos on his social media accounts, arguing that doing so did not violate the injunction because it was footage that had been incorporated into the federal congressional record. Daleiden still could face prison time in California and is fighting eight felony charges for making the videos without permission to record, as well as using a fake driver’s license to enter the PPGC offices in Houston under false pretenses. [CLICK HERE TO READ MORE FROM THE WASHINGTON EXAMINER](http://washingtonexaminer.com) A tentative trial date has been set for December in the San Francisco Superior Court. The Center for Medical Progress did not respond to the Washington Examiner’s request for comment on the status of the case.

The film ends with the on-screen caption, "This film is dedicated to the gallant people of Afghanistan." At some point after the September 11 attacks, an urban legend began that the dedication had actually read "... to the brave Mujahideen fighters" when the film was released in theaters, but then changed to "the gallant people of Afghanistan" after the 2001 attacks, since the Mujahideen were now associated to some extent with the Taliban. This urban legend has been repeated by some scholars. However, this is untrue, and some reviews of the film upon its release even mentioned the "gallant people of Afghanistan" dedication.

author: Nicole Acevedo
title: Unprecedented failure led to the collapse of the world-renowned radio telescope in Puerto Rico, report shows
text:
The iconic Arecibo Observatory telescope collapsed due to the decay of the zinc-filled sockets supporting the steel cables holding up the telescope's 900-ton receiver platform. Four years after the radio telescope at the Arecibo Observatory in Puerto Rico collapsed, a report from the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine is shining a light on the unprecedented failures that caused its destruction.
The steel cables holding up the telescope's 900-ton receiver platform became loose because the zinc-filled sockets built to support them failed, according to the report published Oct. 25.
The failure was due to excessive "zinc creep," a process in which the metal used to prevent corrosion or rusting on the sockets deforms and loses it grip over time, the report said.
The zinc gradually lost its hold on the cables suspending the telescope's main platform over the reflector dish. This allowed several cables to pull out of the sockets, ultimately causing the platform to plummet into the reflector more than 400 feet below, according to the report.
This kind of failure "had never been reported previously in over a century of widespread zinc spelter socket successful use," Roger L. McCarthy, chair of the committee on the analysis of causes of failure and collapse of the 305-meter telescope at the Arecibo Observatory, wrote in the report.
The committee, which wrote the report, said there was…
Nicole Acevedo

author: Henry Sinnott
title: Brandi Glanville Has Even More Questions Amid Her Ongoing Health Battle
text:
“The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills” alum Brandi Glanville opened up about her year-long health battle in December 2024, telling Entertainment Tonight in an interview that she suspects she may have a face parasite. Dr. Terry Dubrow from “The Real Housewives of Orange County” then chimed in on Glanville’s health issues , telling TMZ he thinks it is not a parasite but rather an “infectious process or a foreign body reaction to something she’s had injected.”
Now Glanville is sharing more about her efforts to identify and remedy her mystery illness in a December 19 interview with Page Six’s “Virtual Reali-Tea” podcast .
“I don’t f***ing know. We don’t know,” Glanville answered when asked if she still thinks she has a face parasite as she initially claimed. She went on to share that she is so desperate for answers that, “You could do anything you want to me, and I’d be OK with it. I’ve had days of looking normal, not weeks. I wish. But it comes and goes.
“The pain is more mental than anything, because I have been hiding and going through a deep, deep depression. Even if I could work now, at this point, I couldn’t. So it’s just been a really rough two years for me,” Glanville added.
